function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'c < 1000' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'c < 1000' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'b < c' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'b < c' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'c < 1000' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'b < c' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'a (line 4)' used after its definition?
Does the value assigned to 'b (line 4)' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Does variable 'b' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
Does variable 'c' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'if (a+b+c == 1000) goto done;' be considered dead code?
Is this statement not dead: “for (c = 1; c < 1000; c++)”?
